providerParameter.description: States if the root element should be ignored and thus not be loaded as an object itself.
providerParameter.label: No root object
providerParameter.name: ignoreRoot

providerParameter.description: States if parsing of XML instances is done strictly according to the schema or if invalid property paths are allowed, e.g. if the element order in the data is not correct.
providerParameter.label: Strict mode
providerParameter.name: strict

providerParameter.description: States if parsing of the XML instances should allow types and properties with namespaces that differ from those defined in the schema.
providerParameter.label: Ignore namespaces
providerParameter.name: ignoreNamespaces

providerParameter.description: Combine composite geometries (e.g. CompositeSurface, Surface) to a single (Simple Feature) geometry if possible.
providerParameter.label: Combine composite geometries
providerParameter.name: geometry.combineComposites

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default this option is enabled

providerParameter.description: Activate pagination for WFS GetFeature requests
providerParameter.label: Activate WFS request pagination
providerParameter.name: paginateRequest

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default this option is disabled

providerParameter.description: Number of features to retrieve at most in a single WFS GetFeature request
providerParameter.label: Features per WFS request
providerParameter.name: featuresPerWfsRequest

providerParameter.description: Ignore number of matched features reported by the WFS
providerParameter.label: Ignore number of matched features reported by the WFS
providerParameter.name: ignoreNumberMatched

providerParameter.description: The identifier of the algorithm to use for the interpolation of Arc and Circle geometries
providerParameter.label: Interpolation algorithm
providerParameter.name: interpolation.algorithm

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: The default interpolation algorithm splits arcs in smaller segments based on the maximum positional error
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: Use the grid interpolation algorithm

providerParameter.description: Specify the Maximum positional error for geometry interpolation
providerParameter.label: Maximum Positional Error
providerParameter.name: interpolation.maxError

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default 0.1(unit) is supplied

providerParameter.description: Moves all geometries to the interpolation grid to allow for topological consistency (only applicable if the grid interpolation algorithm is selected)
providerParameter.label: Move all geometries to interpolation gid
providerParameter.name: interpolation.grid.moveAllToGrid

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: Leave non-interpolated geometries untouched
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: will move all coordinates of all geometries to universal grid

providerParameter.description: States if the root element should be ignored and thus not be loaded as an object itself.
providerParameter.label: No root object
providerParameter.name: ignoreRoot

providerParameter.description: States if parsing of XML instances is done strictly according to the schema or if invalid property paths are allowed, e.g. if the element order in the data is not correct.
providerParameter.label: Strict mode
providerParameter.name: strict

providerParameter.description: States if parsing of the XML instances should allow types and properties with namespaces that differ from those defined in the schema.
providerParameter.label: Ignore namespaces
providerParameter.name: ignoreNamespaces

providerParameter.description: Combine composite geometries (e.g. CompositeSurface, Surface) to a single (Simple Feature) geometry if possible.
providerParameter.label: Combine composite geometries
providerParameter.name: geometry.combineComposites

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default this option is enabled

providerParameter.description: Activate pagination for WFS GetFeature requests
providerParameter.label: Activate WFS request pagination
providerParameter.name: paginateRequest

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default this option is disabled

providerParameter.description: Number of features to retrieve at most in a single WFS GetFeature request
providerParameter.label: Features per WFS request
providerParameter.name: featuresPerWfsRequest

providerParameter.description: Ignore number of matched features reported by the WFS
providerParameter.label: Ignore number of matched features reported by the WFS
providerParameter.name: ignoreNumberMatched

providerParameter.description: The identifier of the algorithm to use for the interpolation of Arc and Circle geometries
providerParameter.label: Interpolation algorithm
providerParameter.name: interpolation.algorithm

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: The default interpolation algorithm splits arcs in smaller segments based on the maximum positional error
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: Use the grid interpolation algorithm

providerParameter.description: Specify the Maximum positional error for geometry interpolation
providerParameter.label: Maximum Positional Error
providerParameter.name: interpolation.maxError

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default 0.1(unit) is supplied

providerParameter.description: Moves all geometries to the interpolation grid to allow for topological consistency (only applicable if the grid interpolation algorithm is selected)
providerParameter.label: Move all geometries to interpolation gid
providerParameter.name: interpolation.grid.moveAllToGrid

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: Leave non-interpolated geometries untouched
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: will move all coordinates of all geometries to universal grid

providerParameter.description: If geometries should be simplified (e.g. a MultiPolygon to a Polygon), if possible, before writing them.
providerParameter.label: Simplify geometries
providerParameter.name: gml.geometry.simplify

providerParameter.description: Target coordinate reference system the data should be transformed to.
providerParameter.label: Target CRS
providerParameter.name: crs

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default no CRS transformation is performed, the existing geometries are written with their respective CRS.
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: Reference systems can be defined either as code or WKT (preceded with code: or wkt: respectively)

providerParameter.description: If the output should be pretty printed (indented)
providerParameter.label: Pretty print
providerParameter.name: xml.pretty

providerParameter.description: Prefix to use for all CRS codes based on EPSG in geometry srsNames.
providerParameter.label: Custom EPSG prefix
providerParameter.name: crs.epsg.prefix

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default the CRS code is not modified.
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: Make sure that all SRS names use this kind of notation. The EPSG code number is appended to the provided parameter to build the SRS name.

providerParameter.description: Unifiying the winding order of geometries, before writing them
providerParameter.label: Unification of winding order
providerParameter.name: geometry.unifyWindingOrder

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default, counterClockwise is set for GML instance
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: Unifying order can be set as Clockwise or no change in order (clockwise or noChange respectively).

providerParameter.description: XML ID to specify for the container element, if possible
providerParameter.label: Container ID
providerParameter.name: xml.containerId

providerParameter.description: Don't encode nilReason attributes for elements that are not nil.
providerParameter.label: Omit unnecessary nilReasons
providerParameter.name: xml.notNil.omitNilReason

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default, nilReason attributes are omitted for elements that are not nil.

providerParameter.description: Number representation format for geometry coordinates
providerParameter.label: Geometry coordinates number format
providerParameter.name: geometry.write.decimalFormat

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default no format is used, geometry coordiantes are written in the standard format only.
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: Format must be given with digit 0 and decimal separator '.'. It states number of digits before and after decimal separator.

providerParameter.description: Pattern for formatting decimal numbers
providerParameter.label: Decimal number format pattern
providerParameter.name: xml.decimalFormat

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default no format is used, decimal values may be written in scientific notation (e.g. 6.78E9)
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: The pattern may contain the placeholders '0' and '#' and the decimal separator '.' (once at most). The pattern defines the number of digits used before and after the decimal separator. The placeholder '0' signifies that a digit will always be written, even if it is a leading or trailing zero, whereas with the placeholder '#' the digit will only be written if it is not a leading/trailing zero. In case the original value has more significant figures than the pattern allows for, the number will be rounded.

providerParameter.description: Guiding value for instances per file. The number will be exceeded only in cases where there are too many inter-related instances that cannot be separated.
providerParameter.label: Instances per file
providerParameter.name: instancesPerFile

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default, no partitioning will take place and all instances will be written to a single file.

providerParameter.description: Mode for partitioning the output
providerParameter.label: Partitioning mode
providerParameter.name: partition.mode

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default objects that are connected via local XML references are kept together.
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: The partitioning can also be done by cutting strictly at the threshold.

providerParameter.description: Partition by feature type
providerParameter.label: Partition by feature type
providerParameter.name: partition.byFeatureType

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default all types are written to the same file (unless another partitioning scheme is active)
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: The exporter will create one file per target type. Local references to instances of other types will be modified to relative references, referencing the respective output file. This setting cannot be combined with other partitioning schemes.

providerParameter.description: Partition by spatial extent
providerParameter.label: Partition by spatial extent
providerParameter.name: partition.byExtent

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default all types are written to the same file (unless another partitioning scheme is active)
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: The exporter will create a spatial partitioning of the exported instances by adding the centroids of the geometries to a quadtree. A tile in the quadtree will be split up into four equal-sized subtiles once the configured maximum number of instances in the tile is surpassed. Local references to instances in other tiles will be modified to relative references, referencing the respective output file. This setting cannot be combined with other partitioning schemes.

providerParameter.description: Value for the maximum number of instances per tile. If the number is exceeded, the tile will be split up.
providerParameter.label: Instances per tile
providerParameter.name: partition.byExtent.maxInstancesPerTile

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default, at most 1000 instances will be put into a single tile.

providerParameter.description: Mode for spatial partitioning of the output
providerParameter.label: Spatial partitioning mode
providerParameter.name: partition.byExtent.mode

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default the bounding box of the exported instances will be used as the boundary of the quadtree used to do the spatial partitioning
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: The partitioning can also be done by cutting strictly at the threshold.

providerParameter.description: If geometries should be simplified (e.g. a MultiPolygon to a Polygon), if possible, before writing them.
providerParameter.label: Simplify geometries
providerParameter.name: gml.geometry.simplify

providerParameter.description: The local name of the root element for the target XML file.
providerParameter.label: Root element name
providerParameter.name: xml.rootElement.name

providerParameter.description: The namespace of the root element for the target XML file, defaults to the target schema namespace.
providerParameter.label: Root element namespace
providerParameter.name: xml.rootElement.namespace

providerParameter.description: Target coordinate reference system the data should be transformed to.
providerParameter.label: Target CRS
providerParameter.name: crs

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default no CRS transformation is performed, the existing geometries are written with their respective CRS.
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: Reference systems can be defined either as code or WKT (preceded with code: or wkt: respectively)

providerParameter.description: If the output should be pretty printed (indented)
providerParameter.label: Pretty print
providerParameter.name: xml.pretty

providerParameter.description: Prefix to use for all CRS codes based on EPSG in geometry srsNames.
providerParameter.label: Custom EPSG prefix
providerParameter.name: crs.epsg.prefix

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default the CRS code is not modified.
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: Make sure that all SRS names use this kind of notation. The EPSG code number is appended to the provided parameter to build the SRS name.

providerParameter.description: Unifiying the winding order of geometries, before writing them
providerParameter.label: Unification of winding order
providerParameter.name: geometry.unifyWindingOrder

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default, counterClockwise is set for GML instance
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: Unifying order can be set as Clockwise or no change in order (clockwise or noChange respectively).

providerParameter.description: XML ID to specify for the container element, if possible
providerParameter.label: Container ID
providerParameter.name: xml.containerId

providerParameter.description: Don't encode nilReason attributes for elements that are not nil.
providerParameter.label: Omit unnecessary nilReasons
providerParameter.name: xml.notNil.omitNilReason

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default, nilReason attributes are omitted for elements that are not nil.

providerParameter.description: Number representation format for geometry coordinates
providerParameter.label: Geometry coordinates number format
providerParameter.name: geometry.write.decimalFormat

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default no format is used, geometry coordiantes are written in the standard format only.
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: Format must be given with digit 0 and decimal separator '.'. It states number of digits before and after decimal separator.

providerParameter.description: Pattern for formatting decimal numbers
providerParameter.label: Decimal number format pattern
providerParameter.name: xml.decimalFormat

valueDescriptor.defaultDescription: By default no format is used, decimal values may be written in scientific notation (e.g. 6.78E9)
valueDescriptor.sampleDescription: The pattern may contain the placeholders '0' and '#' and the decimal separator '.' (once at most). The pattern defines the number of digits used before and after the decimal separator. The placeholder '0' signifies that a digit will always be written, even if it is a leading or trailing zero, whereas with the placeholder '#' the digit will only be written if it is not a leading/trailing zero. In case the original value has more significant figures than the pattern allows for, the number will be rounded.

providerParameter.description: The local ID of the INSPIRE identifier of the SpatialDataSet.
providerParameter.label: INSPIRE identifier local ID
providerParameter.name: inspire.sds.localId

providerParameter.description: The namespace of the INSPIRE identifier of the SpatialDataSet.
providerParameter.label: INSPIRE identifier namespace
providerParameter.name: inspire.sds.namespace

providerParameter.description: The path to a metadata (XML) file.
providerParameter.label: Metadata file
providerParameter.name: inspire.sds.metadata

providerParameter.description: Metadata as XML (DOM)
providerParameter.label: Metadata XML
providerParameter.name: inspire.sds.metadata.inline

providerParameter.description: If geometries should be simplified (e.g. a MultiPolygon to a Polygon), if possible, before writing them.
providerParameter.label: Simplify geometries
providerParameter.name: gml.geometry.simplify

providerParameter.description: States if a data set feed for an INSPIRE ATOM based Download Service should be created.
providerParameter.label: Create data set feed
providerParameter.name: inspire.sds.create_feed

providerParameter.description: Title of the generated ATOM data set feed, if created.
providerParameter.label: Dataset feed title
providerParameter.name: inspire.feed.title

providerParameter.description: Subtitle of the generated ATOM data set feed, if created.
providerParameter.label: Dataset feed subtitle
providerParameter.name: inspire.feed.subtitle

providerParameter.description: Rights information for the generated ATOM data set feed, if created.
providerParameter.label: Feed rights information
providerParameter.name: inspire.feed.rights

providerParameter.description: Author name for the generated ATOM data set feed, if created.
providerParameter.label: Feed author name
providerParameter.name: inspire.feed.author_name

providerParameter.description: Author email address for the generated ATOM data set feed, if created.
providerParameter.label: Feed author email
providerParameter.name: inspire.feed.author_mail

providerParameter.description: URL the generated ATOM data set feed will be available on.
providerParameter.label: URL to dataset feed
providerParameter.name: inspire.feed.selflink

providerParameter.description: URL the GML file will be available on as part of the generated ATOM data set feed.
providerParameter.label: URL to GML file
providerParameter.name: inspire.feed.gmllink
